original_solution_mapping.L1: The girls make up one-third of the campers, so there are 96 /3 = <<96/3=32>>32 girls.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The boys make up two-thirds of the campers, so there are 32 + 32 = <<32+32=64>>64 boys.
original_solution_mapping.L3: There are 32 x 75% = <<32*75*.01=24>>24 girls who want to toast marshmallows.
original_solution_mapping.L4: There are 64 x 50% = <<64*50*.01=32>>32 boys who want to toast marshmallows.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7450.
    Returns: the total number of marshmallows needed.
    """
    # L1
    total_campers = 96 # 96 campers
    girls_fraction_denominator = 3 # one-third of the campers are girls
    num_girls = total_campers / girls_fraction_denominator

    # L2
    num_boys = num_girls + num_girls

    # L3
    girls_marshmallow_percent_num = 75 # 75% of the girls want to toast marshmallows
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    girls_marshmallow_toasters = num_girls * girls_marshmallow_percent_num * percent_factor

    # L4
    boys_marshmallow_percent_num = 50 # 50% of the boys want to toast marshmallows
    boys_marshmallow_toasters = num_boys * boys_marshmallow_percent_num * percent_factor

    # L5
    total_marshmallows_needed = girls_marshmallow_toasters + boys_marshmallow_toasters

    # FA
    answer = total_marshmallows_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The girls make up one-third of the campers, so there are {total_campers} /{girls_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_campers}/{girls_fraction_denominator}={num_girls}>>{num_girls} girls.
The boys make up two-thirds of the campers, so there are {num_girls} + {num_girls} = <<{num_girls}+{num_girls}={num_boys}>>{num_boys} boys.

There are {num_girls} x {girls_marshmallow_percent_num}% = <<{num_girls}*{girls_marshmallow_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={girls_marshmallow_toasters}>>{girls_marshmallow_toasters} girls who want to toast marshmallows.

There are {num_boys} x {boys_marshmallow_percent_num}% = <<{num_boys}*{boys_marshmallow_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={boys_marshmallow_toasters}>>{boys_marshmallow_toasters} boys who want to toast marshmallows.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The girls make up one-third of the campers, so there are 96 /3 = <<96/3=32>>32 girls.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The boys make up two-thirds of the campers, so there are 32 + 32 = <<32+32=64>>64 boys.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: There are 32 x 75% = <<32*75*0.01=24>>24 girls who want to toast marshmallows.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: There are 64 x 75% = <<64*75*0.01=48>>48 boys who want to toast marshmallows.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'girls_marshmallow_percent_num' (75) was used instead of 'boys_marshmallow_percent_num' (50).
